item.title: Robert add a quote by Amy Hempel
item.description: " I think of the chimp, the one with the talking hands. In the course of the experiment, that chimp had a baby. Imagine how her trainers must have thrilled when the mother, without prompting, began to sign her newborn. Baby, drink milk. Baby, play ball. And when the baby died, the mother stood over the body, her wrinkled hands moving with animal grace, forming again and again the words: Baby, come hug, Baby come hug, fluent now in the language of grief." -- Amy Hempel

item.title: Robert add a quote by Dante Alighieri
item.description: "No sadness is greater than in misery to rehearse memories of joy." -- Dante Alighieri

item.title: Robert add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "A few light taps upon the pane made him turn to the window. It had begun to snow again. He watched sleepily the flakes, silver and dark, falling obliquely against the lamplight. The time had come for him to set out on his journey westward. Yes, the newspapers were right: snow was general all over Ireland. It was falling on every part of the dark central plain, on the treeless hills, falling softly upon the Bog of Allen and, farther westward, softly falling into the dark mutinous Shannon waves. It was falling, too, upon every part of the lonely churchyard on the hill where Michael Furey lay buried. It lay thickly drifted on the crooked crosses and headstones, on the spears of the little gate, on the barren thorns. His soul swooned slowly as he heard the snow falling faintly through the universe and faintly falling, like the descent of their last end, upon all the living and the dead." -- James Joyce

item.title: Robert add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "One by one they were all becoming shades. Better pass boldly into that other world, in the full glory of some passion, than fade and wither dismally with age." -- James Joyce

item.title: Robert add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Robert add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Robert add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He liked fishing and seemed to take pride in being able to like such a stupid occupation." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Robert add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "We walked to meet each other up at the time of our love and then we have been irresistibly drifting in different directions, and there's no altering that." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Robert add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Robert add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Distant singing is heard. Ghostly voices become audible: fragments of lectures remembered, the finely distilled wisdom and passion of seers and poets with which the modern young mind is tempered for the world that blows it to pieces." -- Tennessee Williams
